info.title: Programs API V3
info.description:
## Common concepts

### ParamQuery

The query parameter search syntax used widely throughout Programs API. Consists of two optional parts: `include` and `exclude`, the query is expressed as `include`!`exclude`.

`include` and `exclude` have the same syntax: a comma separated list of `condition`s, i.e. `C1,C2,C3`. Matches if any of the conditions are true.

Each `condition` consists of one or more `value`s separated by a semicolon, i.e. V1;V2. Matches if an object has all the values.

###### Examples:

`A1,A2,A3` - Matches objects that have one of values `A1` or `A2` or `A3`, i.e. `A1 || A2 || A3`.

`A1;A2;A3` - Matches only objects that have the values `A1` and `A2` and `A3`, i.e. `A1 & A2 & A3`.

`A1,A2;A3,A4` - Matches objects that have either the value `A1` or `A2` and either the value `A3` or `A4`, i.e. `(A1 || A2) & (A3 || A4)`.

`A1;A2,A3;A4` - Matches objects that have either the values `A1` and `A2` or the values `A3` and `A4`, i.e. `(A1 & A2) || (A3 & A4)`.

`A1!A2` - Matches objects that have the value `A1` and not the value `A2`, i.e. `A1 & !A2`.

`A1,A2!A3,A4` - Matches objects that have one of the values `A1` or `A2` and neither of the values `A3` or `A4`, i.e. `(A1 || A2) & !(A3 || A4)`.

---

tags.name: series
tags.description: Search episodes of series and seasons

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Filter fields of the response. Format: `include-fields-csv!exclude-fields-csv`
     Example: `id,type,title`.
     Exclude fields by prefixing the paths to exclude with `!`. e.g. `!image,coverImage` removes the fields `image` and `coverImage` from the response.
     Combining includes and excludes is also supported: `id,image!image.version` firstly selects the fields `id` and `image`, then removes the field `version` from the `image` object.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max: 100

parameters.name: media_language
parameters.description: ISO 639-2 Language code

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description:
A string of comma-separated values that is a subset of {`"past"`, `"future`, `"current"`} (for example, `"current"` or `"current,future"`).

Order indicates preference. For example, to have past episodes appear before current episodes in the result, use `"past,current"`.

parameters.name: publication_type
parameters.description:
A string of comma-separated values that is a subset of {`"ondemand"`, `"webcast`, `"broadcast"`} (for example, `"webcast"` or `"ondemand,webcast"`).

Order indicates preference. For example, to have broadcast publications appear before webcast publications in the result, use `"broadcast,webcast"`.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Filter fields of the response. Format: `include-fields-csv!exclude-fields-csv`
                        Example: `id,type,publications(id,startTime,endTime),classifications.id`.
                        Exclude fields by prefixing the paths to exclude with `!`. e.g. `!series,season` removes the fields `series` and `season` from the response.
                        Combining includes and excludes is also supported: `id,series!series(title,description)` firstly selects the fields `id` and `series`, then removes the fields `title` and `description` from the `series` object.

parameters.name: program_type
parameters.description: One of {`"program"`, `"tvprogram"`, `"radioprogram"`, `"clip"`, `"tvclip"`, `"radioclip"`, `"tvcontent"`, `"radiocontent"`}.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Text search term.
May contain letters, numbers, white space and specific special characters (`-`, `_`, `!`, `?`)

parameters.name: since_episode
parameters.description: Program ID, e.g 1-12345

get.description: ### Search episodes within season

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Free text search. Searches `title`, `name` and `id` fields (v1) or `title` and `id` fields (v3).

get.description: ### List v1 services collection

parameters.name: classification
parameters.description: ParamQuery where the `value` is a classification id, e.g. `31-1-1`, `5-121`, `31-2-8.14`

parameters.name: concept
parameters.description: ParamQuery with a `value` of `id:relation_type`, e.g. `18-123:isSubjectOf`

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Filter fields of the response. Format: `include-fields-csv!exclude-fields-csv`
                        Example: `id,type,publications(id,startTime,endTime),classifications.id`.
                        Exclude fields by prefixing the paths to exclude with `!`. e.g. `!series,season` removes the fields `series` and `season` from the response.
                        Combining includes and excludes is also supported: `id,series!series(title,description)` firstly selects the fields `id` and `series`, then removes the fields `title` and `description` from the `series` object.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max: 100

parameters.name: modified_between
parameters.description:
Comma separated list of two optional DateTimes. Valid formats described [here](http://joda-time.sourceforge.net/api-release/org/joda/time/format/ISODateTimeFormat.html#method_summary).

   E.g. `2021-01-01,2021-01-05 or 2021-01-01T12:00:00.000,2021-01-05T13:00:00.000` or `2021-01-01,` (everything after 2021-01-01) or `,2021-01-01` (everything before 2021-01-01)

parameters.name: program_type
parameters.description: ParamQuery where the `value` is one of clip, program, tvprogram, episode, singleprogram, radioprogram, tvclip, radioclip, tvcontent, radiocontent, tvepisode, radioepisode, tvsingleprogram, radiosingleprogram

parameters.name: publication_type
parameters.description: ParamQuery where the `value` is one of ondemand, webcast, broadcast

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: A valid Yle service id, e.g. yle-tv1, yle-puhe

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Text search term.
May contain letters, numbers, white space and specific special characters (`-`, `_`, `!`, `?`)

parameters.name: series
parameters.description: A comma separated list of 1..n valid yle-ids, e.g. `1-12345,1-45678`

Filter fields of the response. Format: `include-fields-csv!exclude-fields-csv`
     Example: `id,type,title`.
     Exclude fields by prefixing the paths to exclude with `!`. e.g. `!image,coverImage` removes the fields `image` and `coverImage` from the response.
     Combining includes and excludes is also supported: `id,image!image.version` firstly selects the fields `id` and `image`, then removes the field `version` from the `image` object.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max: 100

parameters.name: media_language
parameters.description: ISO 639-2 Language code

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description:
A string of comma-separated values that is a subset of {`"past"`, `"future`, `"current"`} (for example, `"current"` or `"current,future"`).

Order indicates preference. For example, to have past episodes appear before current episodes in the result, use `"past,current"`.

parameters.name: publication_type
parameters.description:
A string of comma-separated values that is a subset of {`"ondemand"`, `"webcast`, `"broadcast"`} (for example, `"webcast"` or `"ondemand,webcast"`).

Order indicates preference. For example, to have broadcast publications appear before webcast publications in the result, use `"broadcast,webcast"`.

                        Example: `id,type,publications(id,startTime,endTime),classifications.id`.

                        Combining includes and excludes is also supported: `id,series!series(title,description)` firstly selects the fields `id` and `series`, then removes the fields `title` and `description` from the `series` object.

get.description: ### List objects that are available in the future, ascending order

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description:
A string of comma-separated values that is a subset of {`"past"`, `"future`, `"current"`} (for example, `"current"` or `"current,future"`).

Order indicates preference. For example, to have past episodes appear before current episodes in the result, use `"past,current"`.

parameters.name: publication_type
parameters.description:
A string of comma-separated values that is a subset of {`"ondemand"`, `"webcast`, `"broadcast"`} (for example, `"webcast"` or `"ondemand,webcast"`).

Order indicates preference. For example, to have broadcast publications appear before webcast publications in the result, use `"broadcast,webcast"`.

                        Combining includes and excludes is also supported: `id,series!series(title,description)` firstly selects the fields `id` and `series`, then removes the fields `title` and `description` from the `series` object.
